author: Divya A
description: The hospitality industry is trying to seek ways of fitting into the current scenario, and attempting to settle a fraction of their mounting losses.
title: How COVID-19 has blurred the boundaries between hotels and hospitals
content: Last week, the image of a luxury hotel in Hyderabad offering a vaccination package worth Rs 2,999 including charges of the dose went viral on social media. Later, more such images came to notice, inc… [+4145 chars]

author: Lauren Pelley
description: A Canadian research team has published new evidence highlighting a combination of two treatments that could help patients suffering from a rare, but potentially-deadly, post-vaccine blood clot condition.
title: Treatments for post-vaccine blood clots show promise but no 'slam dunk,' Canadian doctors say
content: Ever since health officials announced Canada's first known case of rare, post-vaccination blood clots back in April, scientists have been racing to learn more about what causes the potentially deadly… [+5564 chars]

description: Monsoon update: According to the weather office forecast, light to moderate rain and thundershowers are likely in many parts of Haryana and Punjab on June 14 and 15.
title: Monsoon update: Monsoon likely to reach Delhi early by June 15, 12 days ahead of schedule
content: The southwest monsoon is likely to reach Delhi early by June 15, 12 days before its usual date of June 27, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) officials said. Normally, the monsoon reaches Delh… [+1800 chars]

author: Leyland Cecco in Toronto
description: C-230 would require government to study effect of pollution and industry on marginalized people but conservatives could sink planFor generations, marginalized communities in Canada have feared that heavy industry is slowly poisoning their air, land and water.…
title: New bill aims to force Canada to tackle ‘systemic’ environmental racism
content:
